repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: This is a text based on the Jaiminisūtra, a text on astrology. The author of the Jātakasārasaṃgraha is Rāghava Bhaṭṭa son of Goṭṭimukkāla Rāmacandra Dīkṣita. Something is scribbled on the recto of the blank folio at the beginning. At the end recto side of the blank folio has (Blank folio end 1) vargagātra ? tvāt yatateti somavāramapunarvasūnakṣatrapañcādasitithivāranakṣatra yogakaraṇamaśūbhayogaśūbhalagnaṃ diś (Blank folio end 2) velayitijñosyām ?ontraya yā mata?? rativat ? yā patri eva iti josyā ? sthala bitam dhvarasvāmi ((Blank folio end 3) ?hāyaṃ vighnośvarārya ṇamastu śrīśraratreryya karakṛtamaparādhaṃ kṣantumarhanti santantaḥ . It looks like this part is not related with the text. Marginal additions are seen.

msItem.title: Jātakasārasaṃgraha
msItem.author: Rāghava Bhaṭṭa
msItem.rubric: (1v 1) natvā śaṃbhumumāgurum gaṇapatiṃ sūryaYca (lacuna of three letters due to damaged folio.) jaṃ saumyaṃ vākpati bhārgavau śani tamaḥ ketūn girinpaṇḍitān kurve jaiminisū (1v 2) trasammatamahaṃ saṃkhyāvitāṃ prītaye nāmnā jātakasārasaṃgrahamimaṃ kāruṇyatosmadguroḥ .
msItem.incipit: (1v 2) Purā khalu karuṇikena jai (1v 3) mu(mi)ninā āyurdaśā phaladaśā pratipādakāni sūtrāṇi kṛtāni. tatsūtrapratipāditadaśāmadhye asmadbuddhyāruḍhāt kāścan
msItem.explicit: (67v 5) śigrahayukto tatpārṣṇigegrahaiḥ upāsanavidhiścintyassarvadābuddhimānnṛṇām . iti tathā ca sutra amātyadāsecai (67v 6) vaṃ . amātyasaptamaṃ dasena tatpārṣṇisagrahe evavo

support.p: Palm leaf is used for support. Back guard folio is broken at the right corner. Fron guard folio also broken at the edges.

extent.measure: 2 guard folio, 2 blank folio 67 written folio

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals in the left margin.
supportDesc.condition: Good state besides a few folio with wormholes and broken at the edges.

handNote.desc: Clusters are very mixed hence bit difficult to understand.

additions.desc: On the front guard folio has Jaimunisūtra written in the left margin and number 12 is written in Roman symbols in brown ink. Jaimunisūtra is again written on the right side and [Jā]taka[sā]rasaṃgraha is written in the Devanāgari script.
hariḥ oṃ is written in the left margin on 1v.

listBibl.bibl: Jataka Sara Sangraha: A Great Treatise of Jamini Astrology, Dr. Kotekal Guru Rajesh, 2018: notionpress.com

encodingDesc.p: Spelling corrections are made. Spaces are added to separate words.

TEI.text:
(1v 1) natvā śaṃbhumumāgurum gaṇapatiṃ sūryaYca (lacuna of three letters due to damaged folio.) jaṃ saumyaṃ vākpati bhārgavau śani tamaḥ ketūn girinpaṇḍitān kurve jaiminisū (1v 2) trasammatamahaṃ saṃkhyāvitāṃ prītaye nāmnā jātakasārasaṃgrahamimaṃ kāruṇyatosmadguroḥ . purā khalu karuṇikena jai (1v 3) mu(mi)ninā āyurdaśā phaladaśā pratipādakāni sūtrāṇi kṛtāni. tatsūtrapratipāditadaśāmadhye asmadbuddhyāruḍhāt kāścan
(67v 5) śigrahayukto tatpārṣṇigegrahaiḥ upāsanavidhiścintyassarvadābuddhimānnṛṇām . iti tathā ca sutra amātyadāsecai (67v 6) vaṃ . amātyasaptamaṃ dasena tatpārṣṇisagrahe evavo
